physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the volume are arranged in chronological order. There is an index at the end of the volume (ff. 261-272). The index is arranged chronologically and refers to documents within the volume; it gives brief description of the correspondence with a reference number, which refers back to that correspondence in the volume.

The foliation sequence goes from the first to the last page of writing (5th folio from the back of the volume), from 1-52; then 53A, 53B; 54-272. Numbering is in pencil, encircled and can be found in the top right hand corner of the recto.

mods.abstract: The volume contains minutes of meetings at Office of the Secretary of State for India in London, correspondence and telegrams between the Political Agent in Bahrain, the Political Resident in Bushire, the Financial Adviser to the Government in Bahrain, Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, and representatives of the Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited on the Mining Lease and on a survey of Bahrain, for the purpose of identifying the lands granted to the Company by the Shaikh, Hamad Bin Issa Al-Khalifah.The volume includes:copy of the lease including map of Bahrain (ff. 45-53);description of lands owned by the Sheihk and 'Survey of the municipal boundaries of Manama and Muharraq' (ff. 33-39);abstracts of accounts of oil measured during the first half on 1935 and 'Statement on Royalty due for the first half of 1935' (ff. 168-169);documents on a refinery to be built in Bahrain, including letters, in English and Arabic, between the Political Resident and the Sheikh.There are two maps:'Proposed reserve water well' (f. 71);'Oil Loading Terminal at Bahrain Island, Persian Gulf, Mooring Layout' (f. 206).There is an index at the end of the volume (folios 261-272).
